page.title: 06Piddinghoe
page.content: Piddinghoe is a small semi-rural village between Newhaven and Lewes. It is largely a dormitory today with most travelling outside the village to work. It has very few amenities a pub, a public green (known as the Hoe), on the river are a few private moorings and a pond for wind-surfing and sailing. There is no library in the Village but the rural service visits the village approximately every three weeks. Piddinghoe is an ideal place from which to view the annual Lewes to Newhaven Raft Race. Piddinghoe is full of narrow streets, which the local buses sometimes have great difficulty in getting along. The main Lewes Newhaven road bypasses the village keeping most traffic out of Piddinghoe.
